c74object.name: ta.listcomparison
c74object.digest: Compare all items in a list
c74object.description: This object was made to help you compare all items of a list with each other, without repititions. Although it can be used to perform any other element-to-element calculations.

inlet.description: Compare all list elements with each other by grabbing pairs of items for comparison, without repeating any pair.

outlet.description: Outputs a list with two elements containing the indexes of the comparison pair in the input list. "0" refers to the first element in the input list.
The formula is: "n * (n-1)/2", where "n" is the number of elements in the input list. Again, remember that comparison pairs never repeat.

method.name: list
method.description: From the iput list ta.listcomparison will output non-repeated pairs of elements for further comparison/calculation. So if the input is "1 2 3", ta.listcomparison will output the pairs "1 2", "1 3" and "2 3".

attribute.name: maxsize
attribute.description: Maximum number of items to process. If the input list exceeds this size, excess items will be truncated. (default = 256)

example.caption: Calculate difference between all list elements

entry.name: int
entry.description: Out rightmost outlet(3): Total number of comparisons. The formula is: "n * (n-1)/2", where "n" is the number of elements in the input list.

entry.name: list
entry.description:
Out leftmost outlet(0): Comparison pair's left element.
Out middle-left outlet(1): Comparison pair's right element.
Out middle-right outlet(2): Outputs a list with two elements containing the indexes of the comparison pair in the input list. "0" refers to the first element in the input list.
NOTE: Outlets trigger from right-to-left. The right outlet will only trigger once per input list, while other outlet will trigger the same number of times as the right outlet value ("total number of comparisons")
